title: Thalapathy Vijay visiting those affected in kallakurichi hooch tragedy, Watch Video | Times Now
text: On June 20, actor Vijay and TVK Chief Vijay paid a visit to those affected in the Kallakurichi Tragedy. The death toll in the hooch tragedy in Tamil Nadu’s Kallakurichi district rose to 38 on Thursday with several in critical care. Over 100, are still in hospital across many districts.Most of the victims consumed the liquor at Karunapuram in Kallakurichi on Tuesday night.Thalapathy Vijay visits those affected in Kallakurichi Hooch TragedyIn a video posted by a Tamil news channel, Vijay is seen at the hospital expressing his grief to those affected by the tragedy. His visit comes a few hours after he condoled the incident on his social media. \"The news of over 25 people losing their lives after consuming fake liquor in Karunapuram area of Kallakurichi district is shocking and heartbreaking.\"He said \"The recurrence of such incidents indicates the indifference of the government administration, especially after similar tragedies last year\".He also said \"I strongly urge the Tamil Nadu government to take immediate and stringent precautionary measures to prevent such incidents in the future,\".Actor and politician Udhayanidhi also visited the victims of the tragedy. Following the incident, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin constituted a commission headed by former High Court judge Justice B Gokuldas to have a inquiry. He also announced Rs 10 lakh ex gratia to the families of each of the deceased, and Rs 50,000 to those undergoing treatment.Kamal Haasan calls for urgent action Offering his condolence on his social media page, Makkal Nedhi Maiam chief Kamal Haasan appealed to the Tamil Nadu government to curb the sale of illicit liquor. He also stated the need for the setting up of rehabilitation centres to help drug addicts.Director CS Amudhan reacted to the Kallakurichi hooch tragedy on his X account. He posted \"The scale of the Kallakurichi tragedy boggles the mind & should never be allowed to happen again. This is clearly the product of organized crime with collusion from various officials including the police. This government should demonstrably bring all those culprits to book,\".
